page.syntax: Info as P = a5_ADO_to_Array(P ado ,P do )

item.name: .CurrentPage
item.description: The number of the page containing the current record.

item.name: .RecordsPerPage
item.description: The number of records per page as specified by DO.Rows.

item.name: .TotalPages
item.description: The number of pages required to return all records.

item.name: .Type
item.description: Default = "Access". Valid values are: "Access" = Microsoft Access .MDB database "ConnectionString" = all other database types

item.name: .MdbFileName
item.description: The filename of the Access database. Required if ADO. Type = "Access"

item.name: .ConnectionString
item.description: The connection string. Required if ADO. Type = "connectionString"

item.name: .Rows
item.description: Default = 10. The number of rows per page. Set to 0 to return all rows.

item.name: .Page
item.description: Default = 1. The number of pages to return.

item.name: .MaxRows
item.description: Default = 1000. The maximum number of rows to return if ADO.Rows is set to 0.

page.description: Takes an Access .mdb file, or an ADO Connection string and loads the data into an array. (For help on parameters, call with "ado.Help" set to "Yes".)
page.discussion: The A5_ADO_TO_ARRAY() function retrieves records from an ADO compliant database and populates an array.

section.title: Example
section.description: This example selects all records from the Customers table of the Microsoft Access Northwind Traders sample database.
section.example: dim ado as P dim do as P dim global ret as P ado.mdbfilename = "c:\databases\nwind\nwind_2002.mdb" ado.sql = "SELECT * FROM Customers;" ret = a5_ado_to_array(ado, do)

section.description: If we look at the ret dot variable, we see four major sections.
The ret.info section provides information about what we retrieved.
The ret.error section contains an indication of whether there is an error and an error message.
The ret.fields section contains information about the fields of the table.
The ret.array section contains the record data that was passed returned from the database.
To read all the data in the array, you would have code structured as follows.
section.example: ret = a5_ado_to_array(ado,do) for i = 1 to do.rows for j = 1 to ret.fields.fieldarray.size() data = ret.array.rowi.dataj.initial next j next i
